snippet: Playing without Derrick Rose and the emotional leader Joakim Noah, the undermanned Bulls beat the Philadelphia 76ers, 77-69, to stave off elimination and cut their first-round series deficit to 3-2.
abstract: NBA Roundup; Chicago Bulls defeat Philadelphia 76ers, 77-69, cutting their first-round playoff series deficit to 3-2; other results noted. Photo (M)/
lead_paragraph: CHICAGO -- The Bulls may be missing their All-Star star point guard and starting center, but depleted did not mean eliminated Tuesday at the United Center. Playing without Derrick Rose, who tore his anterior cruciate ligament in Game 1, and the emotional leader Joakim Noah, who badly sprained his ankle in Game 3, the undermanned Bulls beat the Philadelphia 76ers, 77-69, to stave off elimination and cut their first-round series deficit to 3-2.

headline.main: Short-Handed Bulls Rely on Their Defense to Stay Alive
